poem:
Title: A Cold Dawn

A harsh symphony of conflict plays 
across the piercing cold, the Eastern haze;
Silent figures clad in winter's grey,
Under the blanket of unrest, they stay.

Echoes of Euros, unseen like peace,
Proffering papers to make the hurt cease,
A faltered smile amidst frozen strife,
The bitter currency of political life.
